briefTitle: Life 4°C Versus Optisol in Corneal Storage Media
officialTitle: A Randomized, Prospective, Double Masked Clinical Trial of Life 4°C Versus Optisol GS Corneal Storage Media

interventions.name: Corneal donor storage in Optisol GS media solution

summary: The purpose of this study is to compare the success of storing a donor cornea in Optisol GS, the current standard vs. storing the donor cornea in Life4°C, a newer solution. The donor cornea to be used for EK will be provided by an eye bank and will have been stored in either an Optisol GS solution or a Life 4°C solution. At 6 months, the doctors will determine whether there are any comparable differences in cell loss and graft clarity between the two donor corneas.

primaryOutcome.measure: Endothelial Cell Loss Post EK for Donor Corneas Preserved in Life 4°C and Optisol GS Corneal Storage Media
